page.title: 05HARTWELL STABLES
page.content: Hartwell Stables is one mile from Aylesbury.There is a disused quarry in the riding field,it has to be fenced off.The limestone taken out of the quarry was used to build Hartwell House and the wall surrounding it. There are approximately 30 horses in the stable. The two staff have three dogs and one cat. Local people can either hire a horse or keep their own at the stables. Riding lessons are also given . The horses are fed on oats, bran, pony nuts, vitamins and sometimes are given barley.
